content: In what year did Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin land on the moon as part of NASA's Apollo 11 mission?

Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed on the moon on July 20, 1969, as part of NASA's Apollo 11 mission. This historic event marked the first time humans set foot on another celestial body, fulfilling President John F. Kennedy's goal of landing a man on the moon by the end of the 1960s. The mission was a major accomplishment for the United States during the Space Race with the Soviet Union.
